name: funrnex

stmt.origin: syl6com(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wfun(c0), wcel(crn(c0), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
stmt.pretty: syl6com(dom(c0)∈ c1, Fun(c0), ran(c0)∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wi(wfun(c0), wcel(crn(c0), universe)))
-| wi(wfun(c0), wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wcel(c0, universe)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(crn(c0), universe))
body.pretty:
⊢ (dom(c0)∈ c1 →(Fun(c0)→ ran(c0)∈ 𝕌))
⊣ (Fun(c0)→(dom(c0)∈ c1 → c0 ∈ 𝕌))
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 → ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wi(wfun(c0), wcel(crn(c0), universe)))
-| wi(wfun(c0), wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wcel(c0, universe)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(crn(c0), universe))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (dom(c0)∈ c1 →(Fun(c0)→ ran(c0)∈ 𝕌))
⊣ (Fun(c0)→(dom(c0)∈ c1 → c0 ∈ 𝕌))
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 → ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wfun(c0), wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wcel(c0, universe)))
-| wi(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(cdm(c0), c1)), wcel(c0, universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wi(wfun(c0), wcel(crn(c0), universe)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(crn(c0), universe))
-| wi(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(cdm(c0), c1)), wcel(c0, universe))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (dom(c0)∈ c1 →(Fun(c0)→ ran(c0)∈ 𝕌))
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 → ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)
⊣ ((Fun(c0)∧ dom(c0)∈ c1)→ c0 ∈ 𝕌)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cdm(c0), c1), wi(wfun(c0), wcel(crn(c0), universe)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(crn(c0), universe))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (dom(c0)∈ c1 →(Fun(c0)→ ran(c0)∈ 𝕌))
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 → ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)

comment: If the domain of a function exists, so does its range. Part of Theorem 4.15(v) of [Monk1] p. 46. This theorem is derived using the Axiom of Replacement in the form of ~ funex . (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-1995.)
